TopicTitle: Can Someone Help Me? I Can't Get Those Buttons Near the Nav-ball to Show Up!

Articles.Content:
As the title suggests, I can't get those dang buttons near the nav-ball to show up even though I have the latest version of the game. This is really frustrating for me and I really hope someone can help me fix this.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-01T21:45:56Z" title="05/01/2015 09:45  PM" data-short="9 yr">May 1, 2015</time> by Mr Muffin**

HMmmm if by buttons you mean the RCS toggle and SAS toggle they are activated with 'R' and 'T' respectively

If you mean the SAS assist modes, they only appear once you engaged SAS. Engaging SAS requires either a Pilot spec Kerbal or a SAS probe core.

Also, if you're in career mode, you need a pilot in order to activate SAS, and for the red/green SAS mode-select buttons, the pilot needs at least one star for those to appear (and more stars to be able to use the more advanced modes)

EDIT: or a probe with SAS

In order to see the buttons, you have to have:

A Probe Core attached - the level of the probe core determines which buttons are available. This is true for all game modes.

OR

A Pilot on board. Your Pilot's level will determine which buttons are available.

In Sandbox and Science Mode, all Pilots are Level 5 - so you see all the buttons.

In Career Mode, your Pilot has to reach Level 1 before any buttons show up.

Also, they only appear when you have SAS enabled ("T" Key)

What game mode are you playing ?

In career, advanced SAS controls (Prograde/retrograde, radial/antiradial, manoeuvre...) need at least a lv2 (not sure) pilot to be available.
You need to be more specific. Are you in career, science, or sandbox mode? Do you have a pilot on board? Do you have any probe cores? Do you have SAS turned on?
